1183.34.text:
That's one of the things I like about
his art, is that he has these, you know,

1187.44.text:
kind of crazy surreal
ideas in his painting.

1189.86.text: Not just the rendering style of it.

1192.82.text:
Rice: But yeah, I mean it was
a hard choice, you know,

1195.86.text:
when Tim decided that he wanted the
game to reflect Bagel's style.

1199.73.text:
Ultimately that means that he's going to
have to paint a lot of the game,

1202.84.text: if not all of the game.

1204.06.text:
And it's going to be what makes the game
have kind of a cohesive feel and look.

1210.18.text:
Petty: I don't see how
it's going to work.

1211.70.text:
So we could either do
something like, you know,

1214.00.text: someone else could render the characters

1215.68.text:
to give him time to do concept
design or someone, I don't know.

1218.24.text:
Something like that, some hybrid
sort of rendering style solution

1221.34.text: that can work in a very similar style.

1224.00.text:
That's the only, you know, we'll have
to figure something like that out.

1226.96.text:
Because there just isn't time for
one person to do all that.

1232.52.text:
Schafer: I love this meeting wherein
we talk about can't be done.

1235.00.text:
Because those are always like,
those are kind of a drag,

1239.54.text:
'cause you're like trying,
you're trying to invent stuff.

1242.04.text:
You know, you're having this
problem with nothing to something,

1243.95.text: like OK, I got an idea.

1245.42.text:
And someone says
that'll take three years;

1248.90.text:
Do you know how hard
that was to have that idea?

1250.78.text: Schafer: OK, I have to go do something.

1255.52.text:
Schafer: As much as
I would like to talk about

1257.18.text:
how we can't make this
awesome game in time.

1262.06.text:
Petty: I thought I was coming
up with ways that we could.

1266.62.text:
Schafer: I know. I'm going to
check out that inventory stuff.

1279.94.text:
Can I see all that cool
inventory stuff I missed?

1286.34.text:
Petty: We're just going to wind up
shipping a game about a red bot

1291.16.text: We decided to ship these instead.

1294.09.text:
Franzke: We ran out of time.
We did create all kind of tech for it...

1297.82.text: Thank God it's up to you to make a game.

1299.72.text:
Here's a tool set, go
do whatever you want.

1302.52.text:
Rice: Yeah, I think there's
always a point in a project

1304.25.text:
where everything kind of gets real
and you see the amount of work

1308.24.text: that you have in front of you.

1310.01.text:
There was a bit of an eye-opener
just through the docs

1312.58.text:
and the processes as far
as how much work is left.

1316.92.text: And how much we can, we can do.

1319.61.text: And the amount of time we have left.

1323.84.text:
Rice: It was an eye-opener that
we needed to get to the moment

1326.63.text:
where we're like OK, we need
to start building this game.

1330.21.text:
And we're getting to
the point where yeah,

1332.80.text: where now the real work is beginning.

1337.20.text:
Schafer: Who was it,
it was like Miyamoto.

1338.86.text:
He said that famous quote about like
it only hurts until it's done,

1341.28.text:
but if it sucks, it sucks
forever, you know.

1343.34.text: Schafer: So like OK, we'll suffer now,

1345.53.text:
we'll put the extra work
in to make this great,

1347.18.text:
because no one's going to remember,
you know, no one ever says about a game like,

1350.80.text:
oh you know, that game had a really
reasonable production cycle.

1352.95.text: That was, I really enjoyed that game.

1357.86.text:
Rice: This was our
fourth milestone of 13.

1360.08.text:
So we need to start kind of pushing
forward, getting some content together

1366.22.text: if we're going to stay on track.

1369.06.text:
Schafer: I mean, off of
what I'm pushing for

1370.72.text:
is like we should just think
about this problem longer,

1372.56.text:
because we're going to
have a creative solution

1374.35.text:
that's going to allow us to have
the great thing that I want,

1377.32.text:
but have it not take 20
years to put together.

1379.92.text: It'll take, we'll think of the cheap.

1381.96.text:
You know, Lee and those
guys are really smart

1383.64.text:
and they could probably think
of a clever way to, you know,

1385.52.text: cut the work in half and get it done.

1388.10.text:
Schafer: But it's hard to
commit to that in advance.

1389.28.text:
Like OK, I'll have a clever idea
and it'll cut this work in half,

1391.69.text:
'cause you know, those things you
don't know they're going to come.

1407.16.text:
Offscreen Voice: Bye, guys.
See you tomorrow.

1435.14.text:
Rice: Potentially getting some
art interns from the Institute.

1438.16.text:
That could do, you know, like the
menial tasks nobody wants to do.

1442.88.text:
Franzke: Well not even menial,
like, I mean all of my plans...
